thread.title: Envelopegate Conspiracy Theories Could Explain A Lot About The 2017 Oscars Mix-Up
thread.title_full: Envelopegate Conspiracy Theories Could Explain A Lot About The 2017 Oscars Mix-Up

author: Anna Klassen
title: Envelopegate Conspiracy Theories Could Explain A Lot About The 2017 Oscars Mix-Up
text:
Envelopegate Conspiracy Theories Could Explain A Lot About The 2017 Oscars Mix-Up Source: Kevin Winter/Getty Images Entertainment/Getty Images By Anna Klassen 3 hours ago 
Well, well, well — it wouldn't be an Academy Awards show without some surprises, right? The 2017 Oscars sure took the cake in terms of delivering the unexpected. Faye Dunaway, alongside Warren Beatty, announced that the winner for 2017 Best Picture was La La Land . But as the entire interwebs now knows, Moonlight was the true winner of the night's biggest award. So how could such a confusing and terrible mix-up even take place? 
According toMarc Snetiker of Entertainment Weekly Emma Stone said she had her Best Actress card on her person the entire time. "I also was holding my Best Actress in a leading role card that entire time, so whatever story... I don't meant [sic] to start stuff, but whatever story that was, I had that card," she reportedly said backstage after the Oscars. 
An explanation from The Academy could also explain some things . As Bustle's Lia Beck wrote: "There are two people who knew the winners before they were named, Brian Cullinan and Martha L. Ruiz, from the accounting firm PwC." Jarett Wieselman of Buzzfeed pointed out on Twitter that Cullinan told MarketWatch before the show : From a security perspective, we double up everything. That’s why there’s two of us. We have two briefcases, that are identical, and we have two entire sets of winning envelopes. Martha carries one of those briefcases, I carry the other. 
With two sets of awards, no wonder things got a little chaotic. But envelopegate, as it has now been dubbed, may require a more creative explanation. Because if Twitter is good for anything, it's showcasing the best — and worst, and craziest, and most unbelievable, and... you get it — conspiracy theories on the web. Take a look. Moonlight Won (& Tupac Is Still Alive) I don't care what anyone says they stole moonlight's moment this is a conspiracy tupac is still alive bey's name was on the grammy card too pic.twitter.com/ZwZUHWrCjt Source: Aaron Edwards on Twitter It Was All About The Ratings Wtf. I'm not normally a conspiracy guy but in a world where controversy=ratings any chance this was engineered?? Also congrats Moonlight! Source: Watsky on Twitter It Was A Publicity Stunt Conspiracy theory: The wrong envelope was purposely handed to the presenters to take over the headlines instead of Moonlight's success. Source: Millennium on Twitter It Was Actually A Tie conspiracy theory: it was a tie between la la land & moonlight so the academy staged an experiment where they announced one & waited for the
